statement.tex: %text Write the projection of the vector $\vector{1}{-1}{}$ on the vector $\vector{1}{1}{}$. %

step.context: \text{The dashed line in the figure shows the} \\ \text{projection of vector $\ora{A}$ on vector $\ora{B}$}.
%text What is the projection of $\ora{A}$ on $\ora{B}$ when $\ora{A}\parallel \ora{B}$ and $\ora{A}\perp \ora{B}$? %
step.reason: %text Projection of a vector on another is the shadow cast by the first vector when light perpendicular to the second vector falls on it. When $\ora{A}\perp \ora{B}$, there is no projection of $\ora{A}$ on to $\ora{B}$. When $\ora{A}\parallel \ora{B}$, the projection is $|\ora{A}|$ because $\ora{A}$ and $\ora{B}$ are colinear. %

step.context: %text If $\ora{A}=\vector{1}{1}{}$ and $\ora{B}=\vector{1}{-1}{}$ and $A_B$ is the projection of $\ora{A}$ on $\ora{B}$, then is this correct? %
step.reason: %text The projection of $\ora{A}$ on $\ora{B}$ can be computed as the (scalar) dot product of $\ora{A}$ and unit vector $\hat{B}$. % \therefore A_B=\ora{A}\cdot\hat{B}= \ora{A}\cdot\dfrac{\ora{B}}{|\ora{B}|}= \dfrac{\ora{A}\cdot\ora{B}}{|\ora{B}|} \\ %text To compute the above, % \begin{align} \dfrac{\ora{A}\cdot\ora{B}}{|\ora{B}|} &=\dfrac{(\vector{1}{1}{})(\vector{1}{-1}{})}{\sqrt{1^2+(-1)^2}} \\ &=\dfrac{\hat\imath\cdot \hat\imath +\hat\imath\cdot\hat\jmath -\hat\imath\cdot\hat\jmath-\hat\imath\cdot\hat\jmath}{\sqrt{2}} =\dfrac{1-1}{\sqrt{2}}=0 \end{align} \\ %text Note: dot product of $\vector{a_1}{b_1}{c_1}$ and $\vector{a_2}{b_2}{c_2}$ is $(a_1a_2+b_1b_2+c_1c_2)$. %
